result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Orell Alexander Davis Jr

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Orell Alexander Davis Jr not in court, in custody.  Attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent appeared by video for Orell Alexander Davis Jr.  Attorney Patrick O'Keefe appeared by video for State of Wisconsin.  
Case in court for status conference following case #21CF1848.  Case continues to follow along.  Case adjourned to Branch 40.
Status conference scheduled for December 5, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Orell Alexander Davis in court with attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  Patrick O'Keefe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in Court for a Status Conference. Defense requests adjournment. Case set next hearing as requested. Case is set to follow with case # 2021CF1848. Case adjourned to Branch 40.  Status conference scheduled for September 19, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Orell Alexander Davis in court with Attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  Patrick O'Keefe appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for scheduling conference.  Court ordered the defendant to appear in person for all future court appearances.  Defense requests a status date.  Court set date as requested.  Case adjourned to Branch 40.  Status conference scheduled for May 23, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Orell Alexander Davis in court with Attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  Matthew Zisi appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  PARTIES APPEAR BY VIDEO.
Court took judicial notice of 21CF1848, 21CF2120 and the defendants prior OWI conviction. Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: MPD Officer A. Keller. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 40.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 13, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Orell Alexander Davis in court with Attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  Patrick O'Keefe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
ZOOM HEARING.  Case in court for initial appearance.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Shelton, Branch 40. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  Defense entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the defendant as to Count 1.  Case adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 10, 2022 at 08:30 am.
